entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the devil's choice that is within 120 feet of the devil and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the devil's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the bounty hunter has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the bounty hunter scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The bounty hunter can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Nonlethal Strike
entries: If a creature's hit points drop to 0 from the bounty hunter's attack, the bounty hunter can choose to knock the creature {@condition unconscious} at 0 hit points instead of leaving it dying.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The bounty hunter deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the bounty hunter that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the bounty hunter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hunting Bolas
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d3 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and knocked {@condition prone}. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 13} Strength check, escaping on a success. The effect ends if the hunting bolas is destroyed. The hunting bolas has AC 10, 5 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the bounty hunter has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the bounty hunter scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The bounty hunter can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Nonlethal Strike
entries: If a creature's hit points drop to 0 from the bounty hunter's attack, the bounty hunter can choose to knock the creature {@condition unconscious} at 0 hit points instead of leaving it dying.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The bounty hunter deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the bounty hunter that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the bounty hunter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hunting Bolas
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d3 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and knocked {@condition prone}. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 15} Strength check, escaping on a success. The effect ends if the hunting bolas is destroyed. The hunting bolas has AC 10, 5 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two attacks with its greataxe or javelin.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage and the target gains disadvantage on its next attack roll until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage in melee or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage at range.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The bugbear rerolls a failed saving throw. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the bugbear can regain 15 hit points.

action.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two attacks with its greataxe or javelin.

action.name: Great Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature and the attack roll against the target succeeds by 5 or more, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage in melee or 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage at range.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The bugbear can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The bugbear deals an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the bugbear that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the bugbear doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Garrote
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or Small creature against which the bugbear has advantage on the attack roll. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until the grapple ends, the target can't breathe and takes 16 ({@damage 4d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the bugbear's turns. The bugbear can't make weapon attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage in melee or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage at range.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The bugbear can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Distracting Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the bugbear hits a creature with a weapon attack, the next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than the bugbear has advantage if the attack is made before the start of the bugbear's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two attacks with its morningstar or javelin.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage in melee or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage at range.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bugbear is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Fury of Hruggrek
entries: As a bonus action, when the bugbear hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal {@damage 1d8} poison damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the bugbear's next turn. If the bugbear expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra poison damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Blessing of Hruggek (3/day)
entries: The bugbear grants a + 5 bonus to an attack roll made by a goblinoid creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the goblinoid hits, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. The bugbear can make this choice after the roll is made but before it hits or misses.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the skeleton hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage in melee or 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage at range.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bullywug hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its greataxe.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes three melee attacks: one with its bite and two with its spear.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Battle Croak (1/Day)
entries: The bullywug emits a frenzy-inducing croak. Up to six bullywug allies that are within 30 feet of this bullywug can use their reaction to move up to half their speed and make one melee weapon attack with disadvantage on the attack roll. The bullywug can then take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature the bullywug can see targets it with an attack, the bullywug chooses another bullywug within 5 feet of it. The two bullywugs swap places, and the chosen bullywug becomes the target instead.

trait.name: Amphibious

entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Swamp Strider
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult swampy terrain doesn't cost the bullywug extra movement.

trait.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The bullywug deals an extra 4 ({@dice 1d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its javelin.

action.name: Javelin

reaction.name: Poisonous Retribution (2/day)
entries: When a creature within 30 feet the bullywug hits an ally of the bullywug with an attack, and the bullywug can see the creature, the bullywug can force the creature to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of the bullywug's next turn, or half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded} on a successful one.

monster.name: Burning Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The skeleton explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the skeleton or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Weapons
entries: Any metal melee weapon the skeleton wields deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Distracting Hand
entries: As a bonus action, while the cambion has the
Mage Hand spell active, it can designate a creature within 5 feet of the spectral hand. The cambion has advantage on its attack rolls against that creature until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the cambion is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the cambion instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the cambion includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The cambion deals an extra 24 ({@dice 7d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cambion that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the cambion doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cambion makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiendish Charm
entries: One humanoid the cambion can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the cambion's spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from the cambion or another creature or receives a suicidal command from the cambion, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cambion's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

If a {@condition frightened} target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the cambion, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks. It can use its Command or Maneuver Allies in place of one attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Command
entries: The captain targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the captain, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this captain that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Directed Strike (2/day)
entries: When a creature the captain can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll, and the creature can hear the captain, the captain grants advantage to that roll.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
entries: A creature hostile to the cauchemar that starts its turn within 20 feet of the cauchemar must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, unless the cauchemar is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.

While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target can't perform any actions except move up to half its speed. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cauchemar's Aura of Dread for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Confer Fire Resistance
entries: The cauchemar can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The cauchemar sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cauchemar makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Ethereal Stride
entries: The cauchemar and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Sulfur Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The cauchemar exhales nauseating sulfurous smoke in a 15-foot cone. The smoke spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and spends its action on each of its turns retching and reeling for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to fire automatically succeed on this saving throw. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not suffer any other effects.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. If both claw attacks hit a Large or smaller creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, or radiant damage from sunlight, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The troll takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. If a troll dies from sunlight, its corpse turns into stone.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. If both claw attacks hit the same creature, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) slashing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite

action.name: Claw

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The centaur rerolls a failed saving throw. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if the devil isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Chain Slam
entries: The chain devil ascendant slams a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by its chain into another creature or a solid surface within its reach. If slammed into another creature, both creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Whirling Chains {@recharge}
entries: The chain devil ascendant moves up to half its walking speed and targets each creature within 15 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

The chain devil ascendant's movement during this action will not provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}. If the chain devil ascendant has a creature {@condition grappled} by any of its chains (not the animated ones), the creature automatically fails is saving throw but is immediately released to a random space within 10 feet of the chain devil ascendant's space where it began to use Whirling Chains.

action.name: Animate Chains (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Up to four chains the devil can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razoredged barbs and animate under the devil's control, provided that the chains aren't being worn or carried.

Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. When the devil uses Multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature of its own but can't make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the devil is {@condition incapacitated} or dies.

reaction.name: Unnerving Mask
entries: When a creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil, the devil can create the illusion that it looks like one of the creature's departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the creature can see the devil, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chasme's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). The chasme can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Drone
entries: The chasme produces a horrid droning sound to which demons are immune. Any other creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the chasme must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. A creature that can't hear the drone automatically succeeds on the save. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to splash it with {@item holy water (flask)|phb|holy water}. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the drone for the next 24 hours. Demons are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The chasme has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The chasme can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chasme attacks twice: one with its proboscis and one with its claws.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 24 ({@damage 7d6}) necrotic damage, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. If this effect reduces a creature's hit point maximum to 0, the creature dies. This reduction to a creature's hit point maximum lasts until the creature finishes a long rest or until it is affected by a spell like {@spell greater restoration}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Chuul Juggernaut
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The chuul can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The chuul senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chuul makes two pincer attacks and uses its telekinetic pull. If the chuul is grappling a creature, the chuul can also use its tentacles once.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if it is a Huge or smaller creature and the chuul doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the chuul must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed} and takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Telekinetic Pull
entries: The chuul projects a powerful telekinetic force that grips and crushes a target within 120 feet. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or it takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and the chuul pulls the target up to 30 feet towards itself. It is {@condition restrained} by the chuul's telekinetic grip until the start of the chuul's next turn or until the chuul is {@condition incapacitated}.

monster.name: Clay Golem Mauler

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Acid Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 90 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. lf no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum

action.name: to 0
entries: If the target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also knocked {@condition prone} and the golem can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action. The reduction lasts until removed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Haste {@recharge 5}
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The cloaker lord's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}). The cloaker lord can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the cloaker lord takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down) and that creature takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the cloaker lord remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the cloaker lord has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cloaker lord uses Command Cloaker. It then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can use its moan or disrupting moan in place of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker lord attaches to it. lf the cloaker lord has advantage against the target, the cloaker lord attaches to the target's head, and the target is {@condition blinded} and unable to breathe while the cloaker lord is attached. While attached, the cloaker lord can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker lord can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker lord by succeeding on a {@dc 19} Strength check.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Command Cloaker
entries: The cloaker lord targets an allied cloaker within 30 feet that can see and hear the cloaker lord. The target uses its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one melee attack.

action.name: Moan
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the cloaker lord that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, it is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition frightened} in this way. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker lord's moan for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Disrupting Moan {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the cloaker lord that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Phantasms {@recharge 5}
entries: The cloaker lord magically creates four illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker lord is the real one.
If the cloaker lord is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear.

Whenever any creature targets the cloaker lord with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker lord or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight.
A duplicate has the cloaker lord's AC and uses its saving throws.
If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The cloaker lord moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The cloaker lord makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Command Cloaker
entries: The cloaker lord targets an allied cloaker within 30 feet that can see and hear the cloaker lord. The target uses its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one melee attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cloaker casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down). and that creature takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the cloaker can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the cloaker can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cloaker makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can use its vampiric drain in place of its bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. lf the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target's head, and the target is {@condition blinded} and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength check.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Vampiric Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature the cloaker is attached to. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the cloaker regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way rises as a shadow under the cloaker's control.

action.name: Moan
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the cloaker that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the cloaker's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker's moan for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Phantasms (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear.

Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight.
A duplicate has the cloaker's AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

action.name: Shadow Jump
entries: If the cloaker is in dim light or darkness, each creature of the cloaker's choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 3d12 + 2}) necrotic damage.

The cloaker then magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can bring one creature it's attached to, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination. The destination spaces of this teleportation must be in dim light or darkness.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Judgement
entries: A creature hostile to the giant that is within 10 feet of the giant has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The giant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/day)
entries: The giant can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Smite (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action, when the giant hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a 1st level spell slot to deal {@damage 2d8} radiant or necrotic damage to the target and it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. If the giant expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum 5d8)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant can use its frightful presence. It then makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The giant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: To Me
entries: Up to two allies within 60 feet of this giant that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to their speed to the nearest possible space to the giant.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant makes a longsword attack.

legendary.name: Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the giant, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The giant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The giant has 13 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When it casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the giant can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When it casts a spell that has a casting time of 1

action.name: time to 1 bonus action for this casting
Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Diving Charge
entries: If the sphinx is flying and dives least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength or knocked {@condition prone}. If the target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sphinx makes two attacks: two with its claws and one to gore. If both claw attacks hit the same creature, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) percing damage.

action.name: Goring Rush {@recharge 5}
entries: The sphinx moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the sphinx enters must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed 5 feet to the nearest space out of the sphinx's path. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and falls {@condition prone}. If the sphinx remains in the {@condition prone} creature's space, the creature is also {@condition restrained} until it's no longer in the same space as the sphinx. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a {@dc 18} Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the sphinx and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads, each of which it can replace with one use of Cold Breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) percing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Cold Breath (1/Turn)
entries: One of the hydra's heads exhales cold in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the cyclops can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyclops makes two greataxe attacks. It can use its Cleaving Swing in place of one of its greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The cyclops swings its greataxe, and every creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cyclops is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

trait.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: Whenever the cyclops casts a spell other than a cantrip that deals lightning or thunder damage, a stormy aura surrounds it. In addition to the spell's effects, creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning or thunder damage (cyclops' choice).

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The cyclops has 9 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the cyclops casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, it can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the cyclops casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyclops makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyclops makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclopskin has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyclopskin makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dao's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The dao can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Captivating Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the dao must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the dao for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to the dao's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

trait.name: Grant Wish (3/year)
entries: The dao can grant a wish spell to a creature that isn't a genie. In order to work, the dao must be willing to grant the wish. Unless carefully and properly worded, the dao will pervert the wish's intent into a literal but undesirable or partial fulfillment. The dao can't grant a wish purposely to serve its own needs.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the dao dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the dao was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dao has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Surefooted
entries: The dao has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dao makes two fist attacks or two maul attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Maul
entries: The dao makes a maul attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dao casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

legendary.name: Hurl Boulders (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dao creates up to three boulders and magically hurl them at targets within 120 feet. The dao makes a ranged spell attack ({@hit 10} to hit) for each boulder. On a hit, the target takes 18 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dao magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dao's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The dao can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the dao dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the dao was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Surefooted
entries: The dao has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dao makes two fist attacks or two maul attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ruthless Command (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the dao can issue a telepathic command whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and can add a {@dice d10} to its roll provided it can understand the dao. A creature can beneft from only one ruthless command die at a time. This effect ends if the dao is {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dark whisperer is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Whispers
entries: The dark whisperer can use a bonus action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the dark whisperer, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the dark whisperer by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the dark whisperer, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends.

trait.name: Psychic Blades (3/day)
entries: The dark whisperer deals an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death knight is a 19th-level spell caster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the death knight must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the death knight by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the death knight, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the death knight's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

trait.name: Smite (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action, when the death knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a 1st level spell slot to deal {@damage 2d8} radiant or necrotic damage to the target. If the death knight expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight uses Command Undead. It then makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Command Undead
entries: The death knight targets one undead ally it can see within 30 feet of it and gives it a telepathic command. The target can use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage and 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Weapon Attack
entries: The death knight makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The death knight moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Command
entries: The death knight uses its Command Undead ability.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The death knight casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death priest is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Mortal Strike
entries: As a bonus action, when the death priest hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. If the death priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Decrepit Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. If both claw attacks hit a Large or smaller creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The owlbear makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its beak. If both claw attacks hit a Huge or smaller creature, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) slashing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Dire Peryton
languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the peryton is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 13 ({@dice 3d8}) damage to the target. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The peryton doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The peryton has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The peryton makes one gore attack and one talon attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Iron Scent
entries: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location offerrous metal within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Rust Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.

When a creature hits the rust monster with a magical weapon made of metal and deals damage, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw with advantage on the roll. On a failed save, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rust monster attacks twice, one with its bite and one with its antennae.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Antennae
entries: The rust monster corrodes a ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster's touch. If the object is magical, the creature has advantage on the saving throw.

If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers . Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

walk.condition: (40 ft. climb 30 ft. in bear or hybrid form)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The dire werebear can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire bear, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The dire werebear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In dire bear form, the dire werebear makes one bite attack and two claw attacks. In humanoid form, it makes two greataxe attacks. In hybrid form, it makes one bite attack and two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage. lf the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with dire werebear lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only):
{@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage, or 18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage while in hybrid form.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The dire wereboar can use its action to polymorph into a Large boar-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire boar, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: If the dire wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In dire wereboar makes three attacks, only one of which can be with its tusks.

action.name: Maul (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while in hybrid form.

action.name: Tusks (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. lf the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with dire wereboar lycanthropy.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The dire weretiger can use its action to polymorph into a Large tiger-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire tiger, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The dire weretiger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the dire weretiger moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the dire weretiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In dire tiger or hybrid form, the dire weretiger makes one bite attack and two claw attacks. In humanoid form, it makes three scimitar attacks or three longbow attacks.

action.name: Bite (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. lf the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with dire weretiger lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The dire werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The dire werewolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In hybrid form, the dire werewolf makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage. lf the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with dire werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Direguard Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skeleton's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}). The skeleton can innately cast the following spells, requiring no spell components:

trait.name: Battle Magic
entries: When the skeleton casts a spell, it can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Displacement
entries: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The displacer beast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the displacer beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Packmaster
entries: An allied displacer beast that starts its turn within 30 feet of this displacer beast and that can see and hear this displacer beast pack gains Pack Tactics until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The displacer beast pack lord makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: On each of its turns, the displacer beast can use a bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action.

action.name: Displacement
entries: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

action.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The displacer beast deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The displacer beast makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The divine trickster is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The divine trickster can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Divine Strike
entries: Once on each of the divine trickster's turns when it hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can cause the attack to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} poison damage to the target.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the divine trickster is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the divine trickster instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The divine trickster deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the divine trickster that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the divine trickster doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, the divine trickster turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). The djinni can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:
will: {@spell create food and water} (can create wine instead of water)

trait.name: Captivating Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the djinni must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the djinni for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to the djinni's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

trait.name: Grant Wish (3/year)
entries: The djinni can grant a wish spell to a creature that isn't a genie. In order to work, the djinni must be willing to grant the wish. Unless carefully and properly worded, and if the djinni has good reason to, the djinni will pervert the wish's intent into a literal but undesirable or partial fulfillment. The djinni can't grant a wish purposely to serve its own needs.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The djinni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice) and the target can't take reactions until the end of the djinni's next turn.
