The beholder can also exert fne control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

reaction.name: Ice Armor
entries: The beholder adds 4 to its AC against one weapon or spell attack that would hit it. To do so, the beholder must see the attacker.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Overbearing
entries: As a bonus action, the troll can make a kick attack against a creature that is Medium or smaller.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the troll can automatically hit the target with its claw, and the troll can't use one of its claw attacks against other targets.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ragdoll Slam
entries: The troll slams creatures {@condition grappled} by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the troll's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hydra can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 20 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 8 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) percing damage.

monster.name: Feral Wight

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Life Draining Touch
entries: When a creature is hit by a wight's melee attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the wight moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the wight can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. If both claw attacks hit the same creature, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The feral zombie has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The feral zombie has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the feral zombie moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with its claws on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Create Feral Zombie
entries: A creature slain by the feral zombie rises as a feral zombie.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The feral zombie makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be diseased.

The diseased target can't regain hit points and must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw every hour or its hit point maximum decreases by 3 ({@dice 1d6}). If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its corpse turns into a feral zombie. The disease lasts until removed by a {@spell lesser restoration} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while with in 5 feet of it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light in an additional 40 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Blast Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The fire elemental emits a searing wave of fire. Each creature within 15 feet of the fire elemental must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails its saving throw, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while with in 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire , the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Distracting Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the giant hits a creature with a weapon attack, the next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than the giant has advantage if the attack is made before the start of the giant's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greatsword attacks. It can use Maneuver Allies in place of one attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this giant that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Directed Strike (2/Day)
entries: When a creature the giant can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll, and the creature can hear the giant, the giant grants advantage to that roll.

trait.name: Burning Smite {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the giant deals an extra {@damage 3d6} fire damage when it hits a target with its greatsword attack. If the target is a creature that is not immune to fire, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} and catches fire, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the end of each of its turns. The creature remains {@condition frightened} until the fire is extinguished. An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to extinguish the fire. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition frightened} and doesn't catch fire.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/day)
entries: The giant can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two melee attacks. It can use Battlefeld Cunning in place of one of the melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Battlefeld Cunning {@recharge 4}
entries: Up to two allies within 60 feet of the giant that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The giant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: To Me
entries: Up to two allies within 60 feet of this giant that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to their speed to the nearest possible space to the giant.

legendary.name: Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the giant, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Greatsword (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant makes a greatsword attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Surtur's Gift
entries: As a bonus action, the giant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. Until the end of the target's next turn, it gains an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage to its weapon damage rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Wrath of Surtur {@recharge 5}
entries: Searing flames surge from the giant and incinerate those around it. Each creature within 20 feet of the giant that is not immune to fire must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage and gains vulnerability to fire until the end of the giant's next turn, or half as much damage and does not gain vulnerability to fire on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The flameskull is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The flameskull sheds either dim light in a 15-foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The flameskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless {@item holy water (flask)|phb|holy water} is sprinkled on its remains or {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell is cast on them.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the flameskull makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a {@dice d10} to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flameskull uses Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The flameskull is an 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The flameskull sheds either dim light in a 15-foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The flameskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless {@item holy water (flask)|phb|holy water} is sprinkled on its remains or {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell is cast on them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flameskull uses Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage.

monster.name: Flesh Golem Abomination

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. lf no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking frmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 50 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks. It can use Fling in place of one slam attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the golem can automatically hit the target with its slam attack but can't use one of its slam attacks against other targets.

action.name: Fling
entries: One object held or creature that is smaller than the golem and is {@condition grappled} by the golem is thrown up to 30 feet towards a target space and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown creature strikes a solid surface, the creature takes 6 bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the creature is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes the same damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The foe hunter is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: On each of its turns, the foe hunter can use a bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The foe hunter deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points. If the creature's hit points drop to 0, the foe hunter can choose to knock the creature {@condition unconscious} instead of leaving it dying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The foe hunter makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the fomorian can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fomorian attacks twice with its greatsword or makes one greatsword attack and uses Evil Eye once. It can use its Cleaving Swing in place of one of its greatsword attacks

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: The fomorian magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. The creature takes 27 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The fomorian swings its greataxe, and every creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

action.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: With a stare, the fomorian uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the creature is also cursed with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity.
The transformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fomorian is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Painful Visions (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the fomorian targets each creature of its choice within 20 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fomorian attacks twice with its greatclub or makes one greatclub attack and uses Evil Eye once.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: The fomorian magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. The creature takes 31 ({@damage 9d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: With a stare, the fomorian uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the creature is also cursed with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity.
The transformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the troll hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its spear.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The frostmaiden is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Chilling Frost
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the giant takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and can't use reactions until the end of the giant's next turn.

trait.name: Auril's Kiss
entries: As a bonus action, when the frostmaiden hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} frost damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn. If the frostmaiden expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra frost damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum 5d8).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Overbearing
entries: As a bonus action, the giant can make a kick attack against a creature that is Medium or smaller.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Battle Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the giant's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the giant's next turn. The giant can then make one attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant swings its greataxe, and every creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The giant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Direct Ally (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the giant, the target can move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack as a reaction.

legendary.name: Greataxe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The giant makes a greataxe attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the giant can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inspiring Strike (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, when the giant hits a creature with a weapon attack, the giant can target up to two allies it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the giant, the target can move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Distracting Taunt (3/Day)
entries: The giant magically imposes disadvantage to a creature's attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. To do so, the creature must be within 30 feet of the giant and must be visible and be able to hear to the giant.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes two greataxe attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one greataxe attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The frostmaiden is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Auril's Kiss
entries: As a bonus action, when the frostmaiden hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} frost damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and can't use reactions until the end of its next turn. If the frostmaiden expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra frost damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

walk.condition: (50 ft. when rolling 100 ft. rolling downhill)

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the galeb duhr remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal boulder.

trait.name: Rolling Charge
entries: If the galeb duhr rolls at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The galeb duhr makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Boulders (1/Day)
entries: The galeb duhr magically animates up to four boulders it can see within 60 feet of it. A boulder has statistics like those of a normal galeb duhr, except it has Intelligence 1 and Charisma 1, it can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and it lacks this maintains concentration, up to 1 minute (as if concentrating on a spell).

walk.condition: (40 ft. when rolling 80 ft. rolling downhill)

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The galeb duhr makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Boulders (1/Day)
entries: The galeb duhr magically animates up to three boulders it can see within 60 feet of it. A boulder has statistics like those of a normal galeb duhr, except it has Intelligence 1 and Charisma 1, it can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and it lacks this action option. A boulder remains animated as long as the galeb duhr maintains concentration, up to 1 minute (as if concentrating on a spell).

monster.name: Ghost Knight
languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost makes two withering blade attacks.

action.name: Withering Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage plus 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4 x 10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Possession
entries: One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or profciencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.
The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The ghost adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Ghost Necromancer
languages: any languages it knew in life

languages: any languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ghost's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The ghost can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ghost is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Whispering Aura

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the ghoul must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the ghoul's Stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghoul attacks three times: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The ant has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the ant's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ant can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage. If the bite hits a creature, the ant can make a sting attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The assassin bug has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The assassin bug has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The assassin bug can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Rostrum Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage, the assassin bug attaches to the target, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

While attached, the assassin bug doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the assassin bug's turns, the target loses 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) hit points due to blood loss. The assassin bug can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 30 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the assassin bug.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullfrog can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullfrog's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Sticky Tongue
entries: The bullfrog has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks when contesting against a creature's attempt to escape a grapple.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the bullfrog can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The bullfrog makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the bullfrog, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the bullfrog's turns. The bullfrog can have only one Medium target or two Small targets swallowed at a time.

If the bullfrog takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the bullfrog must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the bullfrog.
If the bullfrog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The caecilia can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the caecilia can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The caecilia makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the caecilia, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the caecilia's turns.

If the caecilia takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the caecilia must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the caecilia.
If the caecilia dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, the leech attaches to the target, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). While attached, the leech doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the leech's turns, the target loses 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points due to blood loss. The leech can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 60 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The mantis can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Grabbing Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.{@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the mantis can't use its grabbing claws or flicking claws on another target.

action.name: Flicking Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target it is grappling. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The robber fly has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, the robber fly attaches to the target, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. While attached, the robber fly doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the robber fly's turns, the target loses 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points due to blood loss. The robber fly can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 40 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the robber fly.

Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the slug can't bite another target.
