The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The lamia can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lamia is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The lamia can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The lamia has 6 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:
Quickened Spell: When the lamia casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the lamia can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.
Subtle Spell: When the lamia casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The lamia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lamia makes two attacks: one with its longsword or Intoxicating Touch and one with Constrict.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the lamia can't constrict another target.

action.name: Intoxicating Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and all ability checks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The lamia can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lamia is an 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Enthralling Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the lamia's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the lamia, the lamia can force it to make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw if the lamia isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by the lamia.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the lamia until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the lamia in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The lamia has 13 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the lamia casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the lamia can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the lamia casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the lamia can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.
Subtle Spell: When the lamia casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The lamia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lamia makes two attacks: one with its dagger or Intoxicating Touch and one with Constrict.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the lamia can't constrict another target.

action.name: Intoxicating Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and all ability checks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The lamia makes a dagger attack or uses Constrict.

legendary.name: Intoxicating Touch
entries: The lamia uses its Intoxicating Touch.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lamia casts a spell from its list

trait.name: Garbage Camouflage
entries: The otyugh has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in garbage, offal, or sewer terrain.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The otyugh makes five attacks. one with its bite and four with its tentacles. It can replace two of its tentacle attacks with tentacle slam.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure . The disease is cured on a success.
The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: The otyugh slams creatures {@condition grappled} by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the otyugh's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

reaction.name: Lifeleech
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the otyugh is targeted by a spell that allows the creature to regain hit points, it instead targets the otyugh. If an otyugh regains hit points as a result of this, it gains advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

entries: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the lizardfolk can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The manticore has thirty two tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manticore makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) percing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spike Volley
entries: The manticore makes a Tail Spike attack against any number of creatures within 15 feet of a point it can see within 100 feet. It must have tail spikes for each target, as normal, and it makes a separate attack roll for each target.

action.name: Commanding Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the manticore emits a terrifying howl that also rallies its allies. Each ally that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Commanding Roar gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throw rolls until the start of the manticore's next turn. All other creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the manticore Savage
Howl for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The manticore can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes.
Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Skirmish Advantage
entries: The manticore gains advantage on its first attack roll this turn if it has moved at least 15 feet from its space at the beginning of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manticore makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) percing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: When an enemy the manticore can see ends its turn within 5 feet of it, the manticore can move up to half its speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: On each of its turns, the displacer beast stalker can use a bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The manticore deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manticore makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) percing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The mantimera has twenty-four tail spikes.
Used spikes regrow when the manti core finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Three-Headed
entries: The mantimera has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mantimera makes four attacks: one with its manticore head's bite, one with its dragon head's bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws, or four with its tail spikes. When its acid breath is available, it can use the acid breath in place of its dragon head's bite.

action.name: Dragon Head's Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) percing damage plus 4 ({@dice 1d8}) acid.

action.name: Manticore Head's Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) percing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge}
entries: The dragon head exhales acid in an 30- foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the margoyle is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack, the attack deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to the target.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the margoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The margoyle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can replace its bite attack with a gore attack.

Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The marid can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Captivating Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the marid must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the marid for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to the marid's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

trait.name: Grant Wish (3/year)
entries: The marid can grant a wish spell to a creature that isn't a genie. In order to work, the marid must be willing to grant the wish. Unless carefully and properly worded, the marid will pervert the wish's intent into a literal but undesirable or partial fulfillment. The marid can't grant a wish purposely to serve its own needs.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The marid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marid makes two trident attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage, or 21 ({@dice 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: The marid magically shoots water in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 30 feet away from the marid and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Trident
entries: The marid makes a trident attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marid casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marid magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Surging Waves (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marid magically unleashes a violent wave of water that gushes forth from it in all directions. Each creature within 15 feet of the marid must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is Huge or smaller, is pushed 15 feet and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't pushed and knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The marid can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marid makes two trident attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage, or 16 ({@dice 2d8 +7}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: The marid magically shoots water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from the marid and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Water Spouts {@recharge 5}
entries: The marid targets up to four creatures it can see within 30 feet of it and magically creates powerful water spouts beneath them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage, and if it is Large or smaller, is flung upward up to 30 feet. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. At the end of the turn, the water spouts end and the affected creatures fall back down (taking falling damage) and are knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not flung upward.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marilith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The marilith can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The marilith's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The marilith can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marilith makes seven attacks: six with its longswords and one with its tail.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the marilith can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the marilith can't make tail attacks.

action.name: Bladestorm {@recharge 5}
entries: The marilith moves up to its walking speed and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 43 ({@damage 6d12 + 5}) slashing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage. The marilith's movement during this action will not provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Ruthless Command (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the marilith can issue a telepathic command whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and can add a {@dice d12} to its roll provided it can understand the marilith. A creature can beneft from only one ruthless command die at a time. This effect ends if the marilith is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The marilith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The marilith adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Command
entries: The marilith targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the marilith, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Longsword
entries: The marilith makes a longsword attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marilith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the marilith must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, taking 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. The marilith can't use Tail Swipe if it has a creature {@condition grappled} with its tail.

trait.name: Marshal Allies
entries: Unless the marshal is {@condition incapacitated}, it and creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Rallying Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the marshal's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Rallying Cry gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of the marshal's next turn. The marshal can then make one attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marshal makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks. It can use its Command or Maneuver Allies in place of one attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Command
entries: The marshal targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the marshal, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this marshal that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Directed Strike (3/day)
entries: When a creature the marshal can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll, and the creature can hear the marshal, the marshal grants advantage to that roll.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The medusa is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Blood of the Serpents
entries: A creature that hits the medusa with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage and is within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage. Additionally, a swarm of snakes (MM p.338) appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the medusa, and acts as an ally of the medusa.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw if the medusa isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrifed. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrifed on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrifcation lasts until the creature is freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The medusa has 12 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the medusa casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the medusa can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the medusa casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the medusa can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.
Subtle Spell: When the medusa casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the medusa fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The medusa makes either three melee attacks - one with its snake hair, one with its scimitar, and one to constrict - or three ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Snake Hair
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the medusa can't constrict another target.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The medusa makes a scimitar or longbow attack or uses Constrict.

legendary.name: Force Petrifying Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The medusa forces a creature {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} by it to meet its gaze. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become petrifed (see Petrifying Gaze).

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The medusa casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the skeleton moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the skeleton can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing Damage. .

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merfolk is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

reaction.name: Divine Boon
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the merfolk and is visible to the merfolk hits with a melee attack, the merfolk can expend a spell slot to cause the target's melee attack to magically deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. If the merfolk expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The merfolk can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The merfolk deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the merfolk that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the merfolk doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merfolk is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The merfolk magically polymorphs into a giant sea horse or giant octopus, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merrow can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The merrow rerolls a failed saving throw. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the merrow can regain 15 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merrow makes three attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or harpoon, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target is also {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the merrow or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merrow is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merrow can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merrow makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or harpoon.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the merrow or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

action.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The merrow magically polymorphs into a hunter shark, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 17}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantaged.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic makes four attacks: two with its pseudopods and one with its bite or acid spit.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the mimic can bite only the {@condition grappled} creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The mimic makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mimic, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the mimic's turns. A mimic can have only up to one Medium or two Small creatures swallowed at a time.

If the mimic takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the mimic must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mimic. If the mimic dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The mind flayer can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the mind flayer has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the mind flayer scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Soul Knives
entries: As a bonus action, the mind flayer can create scintillating knives of energy that project from both of its fists. It can't hold anything in its hands while manifesting these blades. It can dismiss them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The mind flayer deals an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the mind flayer that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the mind flayer doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mind flayer makes three attacks: one with its tentacles and two with its soul knives.

action.name: Soul Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) psychic damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the mind flayer's next turn.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The mind flayer can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mind flayer is an 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The mind flayer has 10 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the mind flayer casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, it can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the mind flayer casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the mind flayer can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.
Subtle Spell: When the mind flayer casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

headerEntries: The mind flayer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The mind flayer can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mind flayer is an 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the mind flayer's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, provided that the mind flayer isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The wight's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Life Draining Touch
entries: When a creature is hit by a wight's melee attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the wight. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the wight kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The wight magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the mindmantle takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down) and that creature takes the other half.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The mindmantle can't use its {@sense blindsight} while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the mindmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the mindmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the mindmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfng the target's head, and the target is also {@condition blinded} and unable to breathe while the mindmantle is attached in this way.

While attached to the target, the mindmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The mindmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't beneft from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can detach the mindmantle by making a successful {@dc 13} Strength check as an action. On its turn, the mindmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Darkness Aura (3/Day)
entries: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the mindmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the mindmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). {@sense Darkvision} can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

action.name: Madness
entries: A target the mindmantle is attached to must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw with disadvantage on the roll or be magically {@condition charmed} by the mindmantle until the mindmantle dies, is {@condition incapacitated}, or is detached from the target. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, it can telepathically see through the mindmantle's eyes.

The {@condition charmed} target is under the mindmantle's control and the mindmantle and the target can communicate telepathically. The mindmantle can choose to loosen its grip on the target's head so that the target can breathe.
On each of its turns, the {@condition charmed} target must move toward a creature of the mindmantle's choosing and make a melee attack against it if it is within reach.
On its subsequent turns, the mindmantle must use its action to maintain control over the target, or the effect ends.

The target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success. the spell ends. Also, whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The minotaur makes two attacks: one with its greataxe and one with gore. It can use Cleaving Swing in place of one attack.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The minotaur swings its greataxe, and every creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Death Strike
entries: In response to being reduced to 0 hit points by an attack and the attack is not a critical hit, the minotaur can move up to half its speed and make one melee attack with advantage before dying or falling {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the minotaur takes 25 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The minotaur makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with gore.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.
