entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent cumulative penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage.
The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pudding makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers.
The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding. Large or smaller puddings attack only once per turn and deal only half their normal damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The centipede has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw. Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 15} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage. The cube can hold only one Huge, two Large, or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cube makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns, and the cube can't use this pseudopod to attack another creature.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the ooze or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent cumulative penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ooze makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage, and if the target is wearing non magical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative - 1 penalty to the
AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jelly makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly. Large or smaller jellies attack only once per turn and deal only half their normal damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, take 31 ({@damage 9d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpion makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). The scorpion has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30f60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing.

As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the squid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The squid has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The squid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The squid makes two tentacle attacks. If it has a creature {@condition grappled}, it can also attack with its beak.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the squid can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target it is grappling. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 30-foot radius cloud of ink extends all around the squid if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a signifcant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the squid can use the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarantula makes two attacks: one with its forelegs and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Forelegs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shed Hairs (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the tarantula must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature spends its action on each of its turns retching and reeling while {@condition poisoned} in this way. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

trait.name: Invisible in Water
entries: The water weird is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Water Bound
entries: The water weird dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The water weird makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) and pulled 5 feet toward the water weird. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the water weird tries to drown it, and can't use this pseudopod to attack other targets.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 15 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads, each of which it can replace with one use of Acid Breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) percing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge}
entries: One of the hydra's heads exhales acid in an 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The mosasaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mosasaurus makes two attacks: one with its bite one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) . Until this grapple ends, the mosasarus can only bite the {@condition grappled} creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The mosasaurus makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mosasaurus, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the mosasaurus's turns. A mosasaurus can have only up to one Large, two Medium, or four Small creatures swallowed at a time.

If the mosasaurus takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the mosasaurus must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mosasaurus. If the mosasaurus dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Overbearing
entries: As a bonus action, the troll can make a kick attack against a creature that is Medium or smaller.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its greatclub. It can use Cleaving Swing in place of one of its greatclub attacks, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the attack roll succeeds by 5 or more, the target must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The troll swings its greatclub, and every creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myconid uses either its Healing Spores or Pacifying Spores, then makes a stipe staff attack.

action.name: Stipe Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Healing Spores (3/Day)
entries: A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only living creatures. Affected creatures regain 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points.

action.name: Pacifying Spores (3/Day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifce
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the myconid is hit by an attack, the myconid swaps places with that creature and is hit instead.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myconid makes two fist attacks. It can replace one of its fist attacks with Pacifying Spores.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Pacifying Spores (3/Day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nalfeshnee's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}). The nalfeshnee can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nalfeshnee uses Horror Nimbus if it can. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. If both claw attacks hit the same creature, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horror Nimbus {@recharge 5}
entries: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. Each creature within 20 feet of the nalfeshnee that can see the light must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the initial saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition frightened} in this way. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nalfeshnee's Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Ruthless Command (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the nalfeshnee can issue a telepathic command whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and can add a {@dice d10} to its roll provided it can understand the nalfeshnee. A creature can beneft from only one ruthless command die at a time. This effect ends if the nalfeshnee is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The nalfeshnee makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Command
entries: The nalfeshnee targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the nalfeshnee, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nalfeshnee casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

trait.name: Garbage Camouflage
entries: The otyugh has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in garbage-filled or sewer terrain.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the otyugh must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the otyugh's Stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The otyugh makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure . The disease is cured on a success.
The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: The otyugh slams creatures {@condition grappled} by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the otyugh's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

reaction.name: Meat Shield
entries: The otyugh uses its {@condition grappled} victims as a shield against melee attacks. If the {@condition grappled} creature is Medium or smaller, the otyugh adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. If the {@condition grappled} creature is Large, the otyugh adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. If the attack misses the otyugh as a result, the melee attack instead hits the {@condition grappled} creature. To do so, the otyugh must see the attacker and must be grappling with a creature.

monster.name: Nessian Warhound
languages: understands Infernal but can't speak it

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The warhound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The warhound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warhound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the warhound moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The warhound exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the hag makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a {@dice d10} to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious}. The creature remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, or until it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a {@item heartstone|mm} in her possession.

action.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A {@spell protection from evil and good} spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a {@spell magic circle}. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no beneft from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 ({@dice 1d10}). If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Stupefying Cackle {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the hag and able to hear the hag must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 23 ({@dice 4d8 + 5}) psychic damage, and falls {@condition unconscious}. The creature remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, or until it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition unconscious}. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Decaying Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the nothic and is able to see the nothic's eye, the nothic can magically force it to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, unless the nothic is {@condition incapacitated}.

On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 21({@dice 6d6}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nothic uses its Decaying Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Decaying Glare
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest.
The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Mind Twitch {@recharge 5}
entries: The nothic chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw, or it takes 21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) psychic damage and must use their reaction to move up to half its speed to a space of the nothic's choice that the nothic can see. This movement provokes {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

action.name: Weird Insight
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the nothic's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Insanity Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the nothic and is able to see the nothic's eye, the nothic can magically force it to make a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw, unless the nothic is {@condition incapacitated}.

On a failed saving throw, the creature must use its action to move up to its speed and make a melee weapon attack against a creature of the nothic's choice that the nothic can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nothic uses its Rotting Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Rotting Gaze
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Mind Rot {@recharge 5}
entries: The nothic chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw, or it takes 15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) psychic damage, has disadvantage to attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and can't use reactions until the end of the nothic's next turn. If the target is a spellcaster that has unused spell slots, it also expends {@dice 1d4} spell slots (chosen at random). Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

action.name: Weird Insight
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the nothic's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes two melee attacks. It can use its Cleaving Swing in place of one of its greatclub attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target gains disadvantage on its next attack roll until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The ogre swings its greatclub, and every creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ogre regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ogre takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ogre's next turn. The ogre dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The ogre rerolls a failed saving throw. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Wrathful Smite {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the ogre deals an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage when it hits a target with a melee attack and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the ogre's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Bark Orders
entries: As a bonus action, the ogre targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the ogre, the target can move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack as a reaction but has disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes two melee attacks. It can use its Cleaving Swing in place of one of its spiked greatclub attacks.

action.name: Spiked Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature and the attack roll against the target succeeds by 5 or more, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The ogre swings its spiked greatclub, and every creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ogre is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Javelin

trait.name: Skirmish Advantage

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes two melee or ranged attacks.

reaction.name: Skirmisher

action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Whirling Flail {@recharge 5}
entries: The ogre warhulk moves up to half its speed and targets each creature within 10 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks) and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the oni fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Swift Caster {@recharge 5}
entries: When the oni casts a spell, it can choose to change the casting time of that spell to 1 bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni makes two attacks, either with its claws or its greatsword.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or
Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form.

Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its greatsword, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form . If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its greatsword reverts to its normal size.

reaction.name: Fade into Mist {@recharge 5}
entries: When hit by an attack roll, the attack instead misses and the oni turns into a gaseous form and moves up to 60 feet away to an unoccupied space it can see. While in this form, the oni can enter the space of another creature and has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on

5trength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. It remains in this form until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The oni makes a claw or greatsword attack.

legendary.name: Command
entries: The oni targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the oni, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The oni casts a spell from its list of innate or prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)

action.name: Spiked Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). While a creature is {@condition grappled} this way, the oni can't use one of its spiked chain attacks.

action.name: Spiked Chain Slam
entries: The oni slams a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by its spiked chain into another creature or a solid surface within 20 feet. Both creatures must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or
Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form.

Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form . If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.

reaction.name: Fade into Mist {@recharge 5}
entries: When hit by an attack roll, the attack instead misses and the oni turns into a gaseous form and moves up to 60 feet away to an unoccupied space it can see. While in this form, the oni can enter the space of another creature and has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on

5trength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. It remains in this form until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Soul Devourer
entries: The oni devours the souls of the victims it has slain through its Nightmare Haunting. Only through a wish spell, or by slaying the oni, can the victims' souls be free and willing to be resurrected.

action.name: Multiattack

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious}. The creature remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, or until it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or
Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form.

Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form . If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its morningstar reverts to its normal size.

action.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the oni magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no beneft from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 ({@dice 1d10}). If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and the oni gains {@dice 3d10} temporary hit points. The oni's temporary hit points last for 12 hours. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

reaction.name: Fade into Mist {@recharge 5}
entries: When hit by an attack roll, the attack instead misses and the oni turns into a gaseous form and moves up to 60 feet away to an unoccupied space it can see. While in this form, the oni can enter the space of another creature and has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on

5trength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. It remains in this form until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Horrifc Appearance
entries: Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the oni and can see the oni's true form must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the oni is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Horrifc Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the oni's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the oni.
