entries: As a bonus action, the skeleton can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The orc has 6 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Empowered Spell: When the orc rolls damage for a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll up to 3 damage dice. It must use the new rolls. It can use Empowered Spell even if it has already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the orc casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the giant can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: War Drums
entries: An ally that starts its turn within 60 feet of the orc and can hear the orc gains advantage on ability checks and saving throw rolls until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Bone Drumstick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rouse Ally
entries: The orc targets one ally within 60 feet of it and can hear the orc. The target gains advantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this orc that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Incite Allies (1/Day)
entries: Each ally within 60 feet of the orc and can hear the orc can use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one melee weapon attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Hexblade's Curse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the orc targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, the orc dies, or it is {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, the orc gains the following benefits:

items: It deals an extra 3 damage on damage rolls against the cursed target.
Any attack roll it makes against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.
If the cursed target dies, the hex knight regains 14 hit points.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: When hit by an attack roll by a creature cursed by the orc's Hexblade's Curse, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 4 or higher, the attack instead misses the orc, regardless of its roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Nature's Fury
entries: When the orc casts a druid spell, it can make one wolf claws attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Wolf Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The orc magically polymorphs into a dire wolf, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.name: Pactlich

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons

languages: Common plus up to two other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lich is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The lich's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Hexblade's Curse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the lich targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, the lich dies, or it is {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, the lich gains the following benefits:

items: It deals an extra 6 damage on damage rolls against the cursed target.
Any attack roll it makes against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.
If the cursed target dies, the hex knight regains 25 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lich makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its paralyzing touch.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: When hit by an attack roll by a creature cursed by the lich's Hexblade's Curse, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 4 or higher, the attack instead misses the lich, regardless of its roll.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The lich casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Longsword
entries: The lich makes a longsword attack.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich uses its Paralyzing

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich fxes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Dark Hunger (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each living creature within 20 feet of the lich must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and the lich regains hit points equal to the total damage inflicted.

monster.name: Peryton Alpha
languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the peryton is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage to the target. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The peryton doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The peryton has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The peryton has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peryton's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Packmaster
entries: An allied peryton that starts its turn within 30 feet of this peryton and that can see and hear this peryton gains Pack
Tactics until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The peryton makes one gore attack and one talon attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The phantom fungus is {@condition invisible} until it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom fungus attacks three times: one with its bite and two with its tendrils.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The phantom fungus is {@condition invisible} until it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom fungus attacks five times: one with its bite and four with its tendrils.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Pit Fiend Aristocrat's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}). It can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, unless the pit fiend is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the pit fiend by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the pit fiend, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends
If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the pit fiend's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pit fiend makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, one with its mace, and one with its tail. It can use its Fling in place of its claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the pit fiend can automatically hit the target with its claw but can't make claw attacks against other targets.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the pit fiend is thrown up to 60 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The devil magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Hellfire Gaze {@recharge}
entries: The pit fiend's eyes projects intense fery energy in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 30 ({@damage 4d6 + 16}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fne ash and slag. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The pit fiend moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The pit fiend makes a claw, mace, or tail attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The pit fiend magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The pit fiend casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The pixie can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The pixie magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the pixie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

reaction.name: Distracting Taunt (3/Day)
entries: The pixie magically imposes disadvantage to a creature's attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. To do so, the creature must be within 30 feet of the pixie and must be visible and be able to hear to the pixie.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The pixie can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pixie is an 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When the pixie casts eldritch blast, she adds her Charisma modifer to the damage it deals on a hit.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The pixie magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the pixie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, the pixie turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Small or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

If the worm takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm.
If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken cold damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 12 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads, each of which it can replace with one use of Fire Breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) percing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (1/Turn)
entries: One of the hydra's heads exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the quaggoth can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the quaggoth has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

trait.name: Battle Roar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the quaggoth unleashes a battle cry infused with psychic energy. Up to ten other creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it that can hear it gain advantage on attack rolls and deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage to any target it hits with a melee attack until the start of the quaggoth's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The quaggoth makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The quaggoth's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). The quaggoth can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the quaggoth has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa uses Command Undead. It then makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus (7) {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The cursed target is unable to regain hit points. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Command Undead
entries: The rakshasa targets one undead ally it can see within 30 feet of it and gives it a telepathic command. If the target is not {@condition incapacitated}, the target can use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack.

action.name: Pain Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The rakshasa magically emits nervewracking negative energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the rakshasa must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of the rakshasa's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

immune.note: from non magical weapons

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:
footerEntries: fly, invisibility, major image, mirror image, suggestion

trait.name: Aura of Misdirection
entries: Whenever a creature that is within 30 feet of the rakshasa targets the rakshasa with an attack, spell, or other ability, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw, unless the rakshasa is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the affected creature regards every creature it can see, other than the rakshasa, as enemies until the start of its next turn. It then chooses another target at random from among the enemies it can see within range of the attack, spell, or other ability it's using. If an enemy provokes an {@action opportunity attack} from the affected creature, the creature must make that attack if it is able to. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the rakshasa's Aura of
Misdirection for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the rakhsasa fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, and the target's Intelligence score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target is {@condition stunned} if this reduces its Intelligence to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest or if a Greater
Restoration or similar spell is cast on it.

action.name: Word of Discord {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the rakshasa and can hear the rakshasa must succeed on a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw, or take 27 ({@damage 6d8 + 2}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the rakshasa's choice that the rakshasa can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The rakshasa makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The rakshasa moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The rakshasa casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the rakshasa has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the rakshasa scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the rakshasa is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the rakshasa instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the rakshasa can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the rakshasa can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The rakshasa deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the rakshasa that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the rakshasa doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no beneft from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no beneft from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The rakshasa adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the rakshasa must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Revenant Avenger
languages: any languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The revenant is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points.
While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

trait.name: Smite (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action, when the revenant hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a 1st level spell slot to deal {@damage 2d8} radiant or necrotic damage to the target. If the revenant expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@dice 4d6 + 4}) damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape {@dc 14}) provided the target is
Large or smaller.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
entries: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is {@condition frightened} of the revenant for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The revenant adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the revenant must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the umber hulk moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Confusing Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the umber hulk and is able to see the umber hulk's eyes, the umber hulk can magically force it to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, unless the umber hulk is {@condition incapacitated}.

On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 to 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 to 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the umber hulk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the umber hulk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The umber hulk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5 foot-wide, 10-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Burst Forth (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The umber hulk breaks through solid ground or wall as a bonus action, showering the area with debris. Each creature within 15 feet of the umber hulk that is surprised must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength check, taking 23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The umber hulk makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its mandibles.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Royal Sorcerer Mummy
languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mummy is an 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mummy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The mummy has 10 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the mummy casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, it can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the mummy casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the mummy can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.
Subtle Spell: When the mummy casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Runic Shield Guardian
languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

trait.name: Bound
entries: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. lfthe guardian is within 60 feet 0f the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The shield guardian regains 12 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spell Storing
entries: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 5th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefned by the spellcaster, the guardian casts a stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shield guardian makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Concussion Projectile (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The shield guardian shoots from its shoulder a magically-charged projectile that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned} on a successful one.

action.name: Flame Jets (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The shield guardian shoots searing flames from its fingertips in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Shock Burst (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Lightning erupts from the shield guardian, striking creatures close to it. Each creature within 5 feet of the shield guardian must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Force Field
entries: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian's amulet, the guardian grants a +4 bonus to the wearer's AC and saving throw if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifce {@recharge 5}
entries: When the wearer of the guardian's amulet is hit by an attack, the shield guardian swaps places with the wearer and is hit instead. To do so, the shield guardian must be within 5 feet of the wearer

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but he needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of him, using a limited telepathy.

If the sahuagin expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The sahuagin rerolls a failed saving throw. It must use the new roll.

entries: The sahuagin makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or trident.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the sahuagin or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the sahuagin.

Constructs, elementals, and undead are immune to this effect.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sahuagin is an 11th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all her hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but he needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of him, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: Whenever the sahuagin casts a spell other than a cantrip that deals lightning or thunder damage, a stormy aura surrounds it. In addition to the spell's effects, creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning or thunder damage (sahuagin' choice).

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The sahuagin has 11 sorcery points. She can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the sahuagin casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, she can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the sahuagin casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, she can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws

action.name: Trident

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Weapons
entries: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Distracting Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the salamander hits a creature with a weapon attack, the next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than the salamander has advantage if the attack is made before the start of the salamander's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail. It can use Maneuver Allies in place of one attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this salamander that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Direct Counterstrike
entries: In response to a creature missing the salamander with a melee attack and the attacker is visible to the salamander, it can target an ally within 5 feet of the creature. If the ally can see and hear the salamander, it uses its reaction to make one melee weapon attack against the creature with advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes ({@dice 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Weapons
entries: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The salamander's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The salamander can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Weapons
entries: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The salamander makes three attacks: two with its spear and one with its tail.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The satyr is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, the satyr turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The satyr is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Distracting Taunt (3/Day)
entries: The satyr magically imposes disadvantage to a creature's attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. To do so, the creature must be within 30 feet of the satyr and must be visible and be able to hear to the satyr.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The scrag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The scrag has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: While in contact with firesh water, the scrag regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the scrag takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the scrag's next turn. The scrag dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scrag makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Horrifc Appearance
entries: Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrifc Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The hag has 12 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the hag casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the hag can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the hag casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the hag can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours.

action.name: Death Glare
entries: The hag targets one {@condition frightened} creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illu sion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 21} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

reaction.name: Confounding Cackle {@recharge 4}
entries: When a creature targets the hag or the hag's ally with an attack, and the creature is within 30 feet, visible to and can hear the hag, the hag can force the creature to make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the hag chooses another creature within reach or range of the attacker's attack and the chosen creature becomes the target instead. If there are no other creatures within range, the hag imposes disadvantage on the attacker's attack roll instead.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The sea serpent can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sea serpent makes three attacks: one with its bite, one to constrict, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) percing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Huge or smaller creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if the sea serpent isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The sea serpent exhales a line of poison that is 40 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The sea serpent makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the sea serpent, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the sea serpent's turns. A sea serpent can have only up to one Large or two Medium creatures swallowed at a time.

If the sea serpent takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the sea serpent must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the sea serpent. If the sea serpent dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Command
entries: The sergeant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the sergeant, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Maneuver Allies {@recharge 5}
entries: Up to four allies within 60 feet of this sergeant that can hear it can each use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shadow fist's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The shadow fist can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the shadow fist has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the shadow fist scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The shadow fist can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the shadow fist is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the shadow fist instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow fist can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the shadow fist is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifer.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The shadow fist deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the shadow fist that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the shadow fist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Stunning Strike (4/Day)
entries: Once per turn, when the shadow fist hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadow fist makes three attacks: one with its shortsword and two of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shadow fist's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The shadow fist can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow fist can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow fist can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the shadow fist is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifer.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The shadow fist deals an extra 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the shadow fist that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the shadow fist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: Once per turn, when the shadow fist hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadow fist makes three attacks: one with its shortsword and two of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shadow fist's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The shadow fist can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the shadow fist has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the shadow fist scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The shadow fist can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the shadow fist is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the shadow fist instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow fist can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the shadow fist is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifer.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The shadow fist deals an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the shadow fist that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the shadow fist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Stunning Strike (7/Day)
entries: Once per turn, when the shadow fist hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadow fist makes four attacks: one with its shortsword and three of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow fist becomes {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack. cast a spell, or is in an area of bright light.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The shadow fist halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The shadow fist must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Anesthetic Proboscis
entries: If the stirge hits a creature with its blood drain attack without being detected, the target will not notice the damage and the stirge can remain attached. This requires a successful Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check against the target's Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), rolled secretly by the DM.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the stirge can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

action.name: Blood Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 6 ({@dice 1d4 + 4}) hit points due to blood loss.

The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deva's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The deva can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Fiendish Weapons
entries: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the deva can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the deva can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two mace attacks. It can use Life Drain in place of one mace attack.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain (3/day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form . It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice). In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The planetar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The planetar can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Fiendish Weapons
entries: The planetar's weapon attacks are magical. When the planetar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the planetar can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the planetar can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The planetar makes two greatsword attacks. It can use Life Drain in place of one greatsword attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain (4/day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}30 ({@damage 6d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The solar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}). The solar can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Fiendish Weapons
entries: The solar's weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the solar can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the solar can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The solar makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Slaying Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 120/600 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or die.

action.name: Flying Sword
entries: The solar releases its greatsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. If the solar can see the sword, the solar can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to the solar's hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by any effect, the solar is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if the solar dies .

action.name: Life Drain (4/day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}40 ({@damage 8d8 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The solar magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Necrotic Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The solar emits magical abyssal energy. Each creature of its choice in a 10-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Dreadful Glare (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The solar targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition frightened}. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the solar's gaze for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skald is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the skald can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inspiring Strike (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, when the skald hits a creature with a weapon attack, the skald can target up to three allies it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the skald, the target can move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack as a reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skald makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Distracting Taunt (3/Day)
entries: The skald magically imposes disadvantage to a creature's attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. To do so, the creature must be within 30 feet of the skald and must be visible and be able to hear to the skald.

monster.name: Skeleton Captain
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Phalanx Formation
entries: The skeleton has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of a skeleton ally wielding a shield.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Call to Attack
entries: Up to three allied skeletons within 30 feet of this skeleton that can see it can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

monster.name: Skeleton Champion
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skeleton is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It has the following paladin spells prepared, and requires no spell components:

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The skeleton rerolls a failed saving throw. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The skeleton has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes three melee attacks or uses

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Lunging Strike
entries: The skeleton moves 10 feet and makes two melee attacks.

monster.name: Skeleton Knight
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

monster.name: Skeleton Warrior

trait.name: Phalanx Formation
